text.title: part9_Ingrid Newkirk, co-founder of PETA, on animal rights and the film about her life
text.head: Ingrid Newkirk on Ingrid Newkirk

p.hi:
DS : Did you and
Alex Pacheco
have a falling out ?

text.p:
IN :
No — well , we ’ve had
many
fallings out in our years —

IN :
Yes , yes . We ’ve had many an argument , many a falling out , but he separated a long time ago .

p.hi: DS : Are you still in contact with him ?

text.p:
IN :
Yes , he was in touch with the office a couple of weeks ago . I was on the road .

p.hi: DS : Is he looking at becoming involved again ?

text.p:
IN :
I ’m not sure what he wants to do at the moment and I ’m not sure he does , either .

p.hi: DS : How would Ingrid Newkirk twenty years ago look at Ingrid Newkirk now ?

text.p:
IN :
God , what a horrid question ! [
Laughs
] Do you mean twenty years ago ? Because we ’ve had the group twenty-seven years .

p.hi: DS : Just twenty years ago , the person you were then looking at the person you are now .

text.p:
IN :
God , less wrinkles ! I do n’t know the answer to that . I really do n’t .

p.hi: DS : Do you think you ’ve achieved a lot of the things you had wanted back then ?

text.p:
IN :
I ’m never looking ahead . All I want is to reduce suffering and to get people to think of animals in a different way , and that ’s as true then as it is now . Perhaps I was — I do n’t know if I could say if I ’m less or more optimistic , I really ca n’t . I think I was just me , only younger .

p.hi: DS : Do you think other people would say that ?

text.p:
IN :
I think so…I think so . I do n’t know , really .

p.hi: DS : Do you have any regrets ?

text.p:
IN :
Professionally ? Because that ’s what we are talking about …

IN :
I ’m not going to talk about personally !

p.hi: DS : Just in general — in your life .

text.p:
IN :
These are just terrible questions ! I think you can always look back and in hindsight , knowing the results of what you ’ve done , think , ‘ Maybe I could have been more strategic then ’ ; or ‘ If I had only known…maybe I could have pushed harder then . ’ But I think in compromising sometimes , people may find it surprising , but I ’m so anxious not to lose ground , but to gain ground so that we can move ahead , that I might take less than if I had known I could have pushed harder what I could have got .

p.hi: DS : See . Sometimes terrible questions birth wonderful answers .
DS : The nature of this interview is on a permanent encyclopedia —

text.p:
IN :
Ah ! God , help me , kill me .

p.hi: DS : -- so the questions are designed not just around your work , but also around who you are as a person .
